segment.source: How to add test metadata
segment.target: How to add test metadata

segment.source: For Windows 8, the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) uses the Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) for creating test content.
segment.target: For Windows 8, the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) uses the Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) for creating test content.

segment.source: A TAEF test is an object implemented as a dynamic-link library (DLL) that contains multiple methods, where each method maps to a specific test scenario.
segment.target: A TAEF test is an object implemented as a dynamic-link library (DLL) that contains multiple methods, where each method maps to a specific test scenario.

segment.source: The TAEF object combines related methods into a group of tests.
segment.target: The TAEF object combines related methods into a group of tests.

segment.source: For each test, there is a set of metadata that describes the test.
segment.target: For each test, there is a set of metadata that describes the test.

segment.source: To improve test portability and encapsulation, TAEF stores test metadata within the test object itself.
segment.target: To improve test portability and encapsulation, TAEF stores test metadata within the test object itself.

segment.source: When you create your own driver tests using the Driver Test templates, you need to add this metadata so that your driver tests are available and can be deployed using Visual Studio.
segment.target: When you create your own driver tests using the Driver Test templates, you need to add this metadata so that your driver tests are available and can be deployed using Visual Studio.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: The source code for a driver test written by using one of the Driver Test templates.
segment.target: The source code for a driver test written by using one of the Driver Test templates.

segment.source: For information, see How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template.
segment.target: For information, see How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template.

segment.source: To add test metadata attributes
segment.target: To add test metadata attributes

segment.source: Add the required test property metadata to the source files for your test.
segment.target: Add the required test property metadata to the source files for your test.

segment.source: For example, if you use the Driver Test template to create your version of the SurpriseRemove test, the following metadata is added.
segment.target: For example, if you use the Driver Test template to create your version of the SurpriseRemove test, the following metadata is added.

segment.source: Edit the test description, display name, category, and results file attributes.
segment.target: Edit the test description, display name, category, and results file attributes.

segment.source: C#
segment.target: C#

segment.source: Windows Script Component (.wsc)
segment.target: Windows Script Component (.wsc)

segment.source: <!-- Define a test method with metadata: --> <method name="PlugAndPlaySurpriseRemoveTest"> <!-- Required properties for ERT--> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Drivers" value="TRUE"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Parameter" value="DQ"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Parameter.DQ.Description" value="A WDTF SDEL query that is used to identify the target device(s) - http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=232678"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Parameter.DQ.Default" value="INF::OriginalInfFileName='%InfFileName%'"/> <TestMethodProperty name="RebootPossible" value="true" /> <!-- TODO: Properties to be customized to match your test requirements --> <TestMethodProperty name="Description" value="Plug and Play Surprise Remove Generated Template"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.DisplayName" value="My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Category" value="My Test Category"/> <!-- Optional properties for ERT--> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Drivers.ResultFile" value="TestTextLog.log"/> <!-- (see Windows Driver Kit documentation for additional optional properties) --> </method>
segment.target: <!-- Define a test method with metadata: --> <method name="PlugAndPlaySurpriseRemoveTest"> <!-- Required properties for ERT--> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Drivers" value="TRUE"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Parameter" value="DQ"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Parameter.DQ.Description" value="A WDTF SDEL query that is used to identify the target device(s) - http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=232678"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Parameter.DQ.Default" value="INF::OriginalInfFileName='%InfFileName%'"/> <TestMethodProperty name="RebootPossible" value="true" /> <!-- TODO: Properties to be customized to match your test requirements --> <TestMethodProperty name="Description" value="Plug and Play Surprise Remove Generated Template"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.DisplayName" value="My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Category" value="My Test Category"/> <!-- Optional properties for ERT--> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Drivers.ResultFile" value="TestTextLog.log"/> <!-- (see Windows Driver Kit documentation for additional optional properties) --> </method>

segment.source: The following table describes the test property attributes.
segment.target: The following table describes the test property attributes.

segment.source: Use the examples for guidance as you edit or add the metadata for your tests.
segment.target: Use the examples for guidance as you edit or add the metadata for your tests.

segment.source: A short description of what the test does.
segment.target: A short description of what the test does.

segment.source: [Script] < TestProperty name="Description" value= "This test cycles the system through various sleep states and performs IO on devices before and after each sleep state cycle"/>
segment.target: [Script] < TestProperty name="Description" value= "This test cycles the system through various sleep states and performs IO on devices before and after each sleep state cycle"/>

segment.source:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Description", L"Plug and Play Surprise Remove Generated Template")
segment.target:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Description", L"Plug and Play Surprise Remove Generated Template")

segment.source: The name of the test as it shown in Driver Test.
segment.target: The name of the test as it shown in Driver Test.

segment.source:
[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.DisplayName" value="Sleep with IO Before and After"/>
segment.target:
[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.DisplayName" value="Sleep with IO Before and After"/>

segment.source:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.DisplayName", L"My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test")
segment.target:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.DisplayName", L"My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test")

segment.source: A standard parameter for a method call.
segment.target: A standard parameter for a method call.

segment.source: A test can have multiple parameters.
segment.target: A test can have multiple parameters.

segment.source:
[Script]
<ModuleProperty name="Kits.Parameter" value="TM"/>
segment.target:
[Script]
<ModuleProperty name="Kits.Parameter" value="TM"/>

segment.source:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Parameter", L"DQ")
segment.target:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Parameter", L"DQ")

segment.source: Kits.Parameter.*<ParameterName>*.Description
segment.target: Kits.Parameter.*<ParameterName>*.Description

segment.source: The description for the parameter.
segment.target: The description for the parameter.

segment.source:
[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.Parameter.TM.Description" value="Test mode parameter: Logo or Simple"/>
segment.target:
[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.Parameter.TM.Description" value="Test mode parameter: Logo or Simple"/>

segment.source:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Parameter.DQ.Description", L"A WDTF SDEL query that is used to identify the target device(s)")
segment.target:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Parameter.DQ.Description", L"A WDTF SDEL query that is used to identify the target device(s)")

segment.source: Kits.Parameter.*<ParameterName>*.Default
segment.target: Kits.Parameter.*<ParameterName>*.Default

segment.source: The default value for the parameter.
segment.target: The default value for the parameter.

segment.source:
[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.Parameter.TM.Default" value="Logo"/>
segment.target:
[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.Parameter.TM.Default" value="Logo"/>

segment.source:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Parameter.DQ.Default", L"INF::OriginalInfFileName='%InfFileName%'")
segment.target:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Parameter.DQ.Default", L"INF::OriginalInfFileName='%InfFileName%'")

segment.source: This attribute marks the test for inclusion in the WDK.
segment.target: This attribute marks the test for inclusion in the WDK.

segment.source:
[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.Drivers" value=""/>
segment.target:
[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.Drivers" value=""/>

segment.source:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Drivers", L"TRUE")
segment.target:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Drivers", L"TRUE")

segment.source: Describes the category of a test.
segment.target: Describes the category of a test.

segment.source:
[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.Category" value="Logo\Device Fundamentals"/>
segment.target:
[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.Category" value="Logo\Device Fundamentals"/>

segment.source:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Category", L"My Test Category")
segment.target:
[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Category", L"My Test Category")

segment.source: Identifies files and/or folders as test dependencies.
segment.target: Identifies files and/or folders as test dependencies.

segment.source: These may contain any resources needed to run the tests.
segment.target: These may contain any resources needed to run the tests.

segment.source: For more information about using this metadata, see DeploymentItem Metadata.
segment.target: For more information about using this metadata, see DeploymentItem Metadata.

segment.target: Related topics
